intro: Liabum subacaule, commonly known as the slender liabum, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Liabum subacaule is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
